org.apache.hadoop.tools.util

Class ProducerConsumer<T,R>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.tools.util.ProducerConsumer<T,R>

  • public class ProducerConsumer<T,R>
extends Object
    ProducerConsumer class encapsulates input and output queues and a thread-pool of Workers that loop on WorkRequest<T> inputQueue and for each consumed WorkRequest Workers invoke WorkRequestProcessor.processItem() and output resulting WorkReport<R> to the outputQueue.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ProducerConsumer(int numThreads)
      ProducerConsumer maintains input and output queues and a thread-pool of workers.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addWorker(WorkRequestProcessor<T,R> processor)
      Add another worker that will consume WorkRequest<T> items from input queue, process each item using supplied processor, and for every processed item output WorkReport<R> to output queue.
      WorkReport<R> blockingTake()
      Blocking take from ProducerConsumer output queue (catches exceptions and retries forever).
      int getWorkCnt()
      Returns number of pending ProducerConsumer items (submitted to input queue for processing via put() method but not yet consumed by take() or blockingTake().
      boolean hasWork()
      Returns true if there are items in ProducerConsumer that are either pending for processing or waiting to be consumed.
      void put(WorkRequest<T> workRequest)
      Blocking put workRequest to ProducerConsumer input queue.
      void shutdown()
      Shutdown ProducerConsumer worker thread-pool without waiting for completion of any pending work.
      WorkReport<R> take()
      Blocking take from ProducerConsumer output queue that can be interrupted.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ProducerConsumer

        public ProducerConsumer(int numThreads)
        ProducerConsumer maintains input and output queues and a thread-pool of workers.
        Parameters:
        numThreads - Size of thread-pool to execute Workers.

    • Method Detail

      • addWorker

        public void addWorker(WorkRequestProcessor<T,R> processor)
        Add another worker that will consume WorkRequest<T> items from input queue, process each item using supplied processor, and for every processed item output WorkReport<R> to output queue.
        Parameters:
        processor - Processor implementing WorkRequestProcessor interface.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown ProducerConsumer worker thread-pool without waiting for completion of any pending work.

      • getWorkCnt

        public int getWorkCnt()
        Returns number of pending ProducerConsumer items (submitted to input queue for processing via put() method but not yet consumed by take() or blockingTake().
        Returns:
        Number of items in ProducerConsumer (either pending for processing or waiting to be consumed).

      • hasWork

        public boolean hasWork()
        Returns true if there are items in ProducerConsumer that are either pending for processing or waiting to be consumed.
        Returns:
        True if there were more items put() to ProducerConsumer than consumed by take() or blockingTake().

      • put

        public void put(WorkRequest<T> workRequest)
        Blocking put workRequest to ProducerConsumer input queue.
        Parameters:
        workRequest - item to be processed.

      • take

        public WorkReport<R> take()
                   throws InterruptedException
        Blocking take from ProducerConsumer output queue that can be interrupted.
        Returns:
        item returned by processor's processItem().
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if interrupted before an element becomes available.

      • blockingTake

        public WorkReport<R> blockingTake()
        Blocking take from ProducerConsumer output queue (catches exceptions and retries forever).
        Returns:
        item returned by processor's processItem().
